alert.note: Alert for Culpeper; Fairfax; Fauquier; King George; Orange; Prince William; Spotsylvania; Stafford (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 17 at 11:41PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 AM EST MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central and northern Virginia, including the following counties, in central Virginia, City of Fredericksburg, King George, Orange and Spotsylvania. In northern Virginia, Culpeper, Fairfax, Fauquier, Prince William and Stafford. * WHEN...Until 545 AM EST Monday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1140 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Stafford... Dale City... Fredericksburg... King George... Woodbridge... Dahlgren... Quantico... Fairview Beach... Aquia Creek... Potomac Creek... Nanjemoy Creek... Montclair... Triangle... Dumfries... Massaponax... Spotsylvania... Cherry Hill... Independent Hill... Falmouth... Mason Neck... - Please visit weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

area.areaDesc: Culpeper; Fairfax; Fauquier; King George; Orange; Prince William; Spotsylvania; Stafford
